column2:
By typing in your Prolific ID and submitting, you acknowledge that:

- You are at least 18 years of age.
- You have read and understood this information.
- You agree to participate and allow your anonymous responses to be used for academic research.
column3:
Please read carefully before continuing.
This survey will take approximately 60 minutes to complete. We ask that you respond thoughtfully and seriously — your input is highly valuable to our research.
There are 30 questions, divided into chats of 20 minutes each.
We encourage you to use the microphone and answer in detail — we will only keep the transcript.
Participants who complete the survey attentively will receive fair compensation through Prolific.
Are you willing to proceed?

column4: In the past 5 years my housing experience was just me staying at home, after covid happened, I moved back to my parents place and been staying ever since.

column11: Management, business, science, and arts occupations

column4: Over the past five years I have rented houses, moved from one apartment to another. However, recently I bought a house. The apartments were congested and it was not easy to find own compound house, hence the decision to buy my own house.
column6: Different house in United States 1 year ago
column9: Car / Truck / Van, Taxi / cab, Walk, Public Transportation, Worked from home
column11: Service occupations

column4: I have experienced several changes in my housing situation due to financial, personal, and employment-related reasons. I initially lived in a rental apartment but had to move when the rent increased beyond what I could afford. I then stayed temporarily with family while I searched for a more affordable option. After securing a steady income, I moved into a new rental unit, where I stayed for a couple of years. Most recently, I had to relocate again due to the property being sold by the owner. Throughout this time, my focus has been on maintaining stable, safe, and affordable housing as circumstances evolved.
column11: Natural resources, construction, and maintenance occupations

column4: Over the past five years, I’ve moved a couple of times. I was renting a one-bedroom, but the rent kept going up, so I had to look for something cheaper. I ended up moving to a different neighborhood that wasn’t my first choice, but it was more affordable. Then I moved again to be closer to my job and to get a bit more space. Honestly, each move was mostly about trying to make things work financially and finding a decent place that fit my needs.
column11: Management, business, science, and arts occupations

column4: I have been renting half of a duplex from my stepmother for the past 5+ years, it has honestly been a nightmare, but at least somewhat stable, although it does not feel that way.
column11: Service occupations

column4: In the past five years, I have moved twice. Initially, I rented a one-bedroom apartment in a high-demand urban area, but after a rent increase, I relocated to a more affordable neighborhood. About two years ago, I moved again due to a job change that required me to be closer to a new office. Each move was influenced by rising housing costs, work-related factors, and the desire for better living conditions.
column9: Car / Truck / Van, Taxi / cab, Public Transportation
column11: Management, business, science, and arts occupations

column4: I moved a couple of times from late 2010s to early 2020s. This was due to trying to find a better location and cost since some of the people we were with previously would not be staying. The places were rented and were small apartment buildings. The owners of the building were slow when it came to responding to issue such as the fridge being broken, and were acting greedy regarding the end lease when moving. I now live in a house which means more space, and feels less crowded in general.

column4:
I've actually moved a couple of times in the last few years. The first move was because my old place was getting really expensive, and I wasn't getting as much space as I wanted. I ended up finding a slightly smaller place, but the rent was way better, and it was in a much better location for me.

Then, a couple of years later, I moved again, this time because I got a new job in a different city. I had to find a place pretty quickly, so I ended up renting an apartment. It was a bit of a hassle at first, but it's been working out okay.
